results.title: Nyols
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on Patricia Wrightsons novel of the same name, this is the story of Simon Brent who comes to live with country relatives when his parents are killed. In this episode Simon and his cousins Charlie and Eddie discover the menacing Nyols.

results.title: Turongs
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on the novel by Patricia Wrightson, this story of Simon Brent, the city boy who comes to live with his country relatives after the death of his parents, follows the adventures of Simon and his cousins as they meet and battle menacing creatures from the Aboriginal dreamtime. In this episode the intrepid adventurers come face to face with the Turongs.

results.title: Potkoorok
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
Based on the novel of the same name by Patricia Wrightson, this is the story of Simon Brent, a city boy sent to live with country relatives after the death of his parents. He resents the move to a different lifestyle and is bored with country life until he meets some ancient creatures that have inhabited the area since Dreamtime. In this episode he stumbles upon The Potkoorok, a fierce and loathesome creature.

results.title: Simon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
A television adaptation of Patricia Wrightson’s novel of the same name, this series is the story of Simon Brent, a 10 year old city boy who is placed in the care of country relatives when his parents are killed in a car crash. Simon finds life very boring until he explores a nearby swamp, where he experiences some odd happenings and finally meets a strange swamp creature called The Potkoorok. From that time on, life is considerably more exciting, mysterious and dangerous for Simon and his relatives, Charlie and Eddie, as they do battle with a menacing giant rock known as The Nargun.

results.title: Simon
results.creator_credit: Hans Casparius, Anne Balfour Fraser and Independent Cine Art
results.brief_description: Simon, a clumsy and slightly backward boy, joins his young playmates in their games in the woods, but is tormented and finally abandoned by them. In this experimental film, the children were given only a rough outline of each scene and themselves improvised the details. The central theme of bullying and group cruelty pinpoints a private purgatory familiar to every child. The beauty of the woodlands where the action takes place symbolises the supposedly innocent natures of children, stressing the disillusioning contrast with their behaviour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hans Casparius, Anne Balfour Fraser and Independent Cine Art

results.title: Simmo, the man I love
results.brief_description: John’s reputation as a great pilot earned him the respect of his colleagues, especially one admirer, Yolanta. But towards the end of his career, it felt like he was losing his touch, something was wrong. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: You've changed
results.brief_description: From the time he was awarded a Churchill Fellowship in 1969, Conrad’s life has been one of achievement. A skilled builder, a respected intellect and an icon in forestry aviation, Conrad now needs full-time care due to dementia. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Carmel: storyteller
results.brief_description: Carmel is a retired school teacher, wife, mother and grandmother. Her family’ s life dramatically changed when she was diagnosed with early onset memory loss. With her husband, she tells their story and looks positively in the face of an unknown future. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Max and Noel Oliver's story
results.brief_description:
Alzheimer’s sufferer Max together with his wife Noel have told a story for their granddaughters that celebrates their life together as well as capturing Max’s memories of his son, the children’s father, who died when they were very young. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Peg: a life to remember
results.brief_description: Peg and Bryan have been trekking all over the world since 1987. Bryan recalls their travels and the great times spent with his wife, who now has Alzheimer’s disease. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.
